enum.name: uninitialized
enum.description: The StreamFilter is not fully initialized. No methods may be called until a "start" event has been received.

enum.name: transferringdata
enum.description: The underlying channel is currently transferring data, which will be dispatched via "data" events.

enum.name: finishedtransferringdata
enum.description: The underlying channel has finished transferring data. Data may still be written via write() calls at this point.

enum.name: suspended
enum.description: Data transfer is currently suspended. It may be resumed by a call to resume(). Data may still be written via write() calls in this state.

enum.name: closed
enum.description: The channel has been closed by a call to close(). No further data wlil be delivered via "data" events, and no further data may be written via write() calls.

enum.name: disconnected
enum.description: The channel has been disconnected by a call to disconnect(). All further data will be delivered directly, without passing through the filter. No further events will be dispatched, and no further data may be written by write() calls.

enum.name: failed
enum.description: An error has occurred and the channel is disconnected. The `error`, property contains the details of the error.

types.+[].description: An interface which allows an extension to intercept, and optionally modify, response data from an HTTP request.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a stream filter for the given add-on and the given extension ID.

functions.name: suspend
functions.description: Suspends processing of the request. After this is called, no further data will be delivered until the request is resumed.

functions.name: resume
functions.description: Resumes delivery of data for a suspended request.

functions.name: close
functions.description: Closes the request. After this is called, no more data may be written to the stream, and no further data will be delivered. This *must* be called after the consumer is finished writing data, unless disconnect() has already been called.

functions.name: disconnect
functions.description: Disconnects the stream filter from the request. After this is called, no further data will be delivered to the filter, and any unprocessed data will be written directly to the output stream.

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes a chunk of data to the output stream. This may not be called before the "start" event has been received.

status.description: Returns the current status of the stream.

error.description: After an "error" event has been dispatched, this contains a message describing the error.

events.description: Dispatched with a StreamFilterDataEvent whenever incoming data is available on the stream. This data will not be delivered to the output stream unless it is explicitly written via a write() call.
Dispatched when the stream is opened, and is about to begin delivering data.
Dispatched when the stream has closed, and has no more data to deliver. The output stream remains open and writable until close() is called.
Dispatched when an error has occurred. No further data may be read or written after this point.

data.description: Contains a chunk of data read from the input stream.
